result.execSummary:
The defendant Frederick K. Putz Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Frederick K. Putz, Jr. in custody, in person in court.  District Attorney Bruce Poquette appeared for the State.  Proposed joint agreement.  Court not going to follow plea agreement completely.  Count 1-sentence IMPOSED AND STAYED, 9 months County Jail, credit for time served of 46 days, fine $768.00, Probation 2 years, with conditions of 80 days in County Jail (Beginning 6-30-14 at 9AM), 46 days credit days served, AODA treatment and follow through, no contact with Kimberly Yackley, absolute sobriety/no alcohol/drug use without valid Rx, and anger management assessment and follow through.

$500 bond forwarded to DOC.  Court gave DE appeal rights.
